name: 5-(2,5-dichlorophenyl)-3-(thiophen-2-ylcarbonyl)-3aH-pyrrolo[3,4-d]isoxazole-4,6(5H,6aH)-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2203
Reason: 5-(2,5-dichlorophenyl)-3-(thiophen-2-ylcarbonyl)-3aH-pyrrolo[3,4-d]isoxazole-4,6(5H,6aH)-dione has a complex structure with multiple functional groups that impact its melting point. The basic unit for comparison is 3aH-pyrrolo[3,4-d]isoxazole, which has a melting point around 100 degrees Celsius. The presence of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion significantly enhances the melting point due to the increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100 degrees Celsius to the melting point due to the increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity. Additionally, the thiophen-2-ylcarbonyl group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +20 to +40°C. The two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion significantly enhance the melting point due to the increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity.
